attributes.action: Stop raising prices for at least 3 months due to Covid 19.
attributes.additional_details: People are getting jobless, and some have to self isolate or quarantine. The government raising benefits and reduce mortgages and rent but prices from the producers, shops and supermarkets are getting higher instead of getting lower to help those in need.
attributes.background: Please stop raising prices from the producers, shops and supermarkets, for at least 3 months due to situation we are in.

rejection.details:
The price of consumer goods is a matter for individual producers and retailers, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to restrict people stockpiling and reselling items at inflated prices, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303070

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
